attributes.action: Make drinking water free of charge inside the airports and train stations.
attributes.background: It's a great shame that you have to pay for drinking water at the airport, not even that but it is often way to overpriced. In a world full of gready businesses, where the proffits in this field reach hundreds of millions come join and let's make them give something back.

attributes.action: Increase the maximum jail term for flying a drone over a UK airport to 10 years.
attributes.background:
The signatories to this petition want to see the maximum sentence for flying an unmanned drone over a UK airport increased from 5 to 10 years.

We also want clear direction given to the courts that severe sentences - close to or at the maximum - should be handed down for such reckless behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
We have recently seen (December 2018) the scant disregard for the safety of aircraft, passengers and staff by those intentionally flying an unmanned drone over protected airspace at London Gatwick Airport.

Given the risk to human life from such reckless actions, and the significant cost and disruption, signatories to this period want to see the minimum sentence raised to ten years and used for mindless idiots endangering life.

attributes.action: Propose that the European Union be disband.
attributes.background: Greece is bankrupt, Italy is bankrupt, Spain, Cyprus and now France are all on the brink on bankruptcy. Why do people want us to remain when we are going lose all money within a couple of months.
attributes.additional_details:
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/europpblog/2012/06/18/abandon-eu/ 
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/may/26/danger-brexit-break-up-eu-europe-russia 
https://www.debate.org/opinions/should-the-european-union-be-dissolved

attributes.action: Allow teaching of Quran to Muslim kids as part of required RE in primary schools
attributes.background: All Muslim kids going to Mosque after school for Quran reading. They are too tired every day after studying at two institutes school and Mosque.
attributes.additional_details: We have to make both possible at one place in the best interest of kids. The law should change so Muslim children can learn the Quran at primary schools.

attributes.action: Amend rail franchises so fares cannot be increased until trains are 90% on time
attributes.background: The current train operator of South west trains are so bad. The service is worst than the operator that was there before. Now they are increasing the rail fares when the service is so bad (trains are either delayed or cancelled).

attributes.action: Improve the recruiting drive for the British armed forces.
attributes.background: I don’t feel enough is being done, as a current applicant myself I can see simply not enough is being done. We need to bring back recruiting ads to TV, make the application process more appealing to a civilian and improve the quality of ad, in particular the army (look at the Royal Marines adverts).

attributes.action: I’m asking for mindfulness and self love taught compulsory in schools.
attributes.background: The mental health and crime rates are at a controllable level if you actively put in place the right solution. Mindfulness meditation and self love and appreciation of others should be taught compulsory in schools as this could mean the difference for our next generation. This can only be positive.
attributes.additional_details: We are moving in to a time where children are struggling with self love, love of others and the ability to handle emotions, not being able to handle emotions results in dissociating with them, this is why most children and adult are currently suffering. We need to teach children how to love one another for internal attributes and ensure meditation in the morning so they are ready for their day. Children work harder than we think and deserve the right care, they rest their bodies what about minds

attributes.action: Make mental health education compulsory in high schools
attributes.background: I did a survey of 250 teenage girls re:their mental health and found that over half of the factors that contributed to their mental health issues stemmed from school environment. to me, this indicates that compulsory PSHE lessons on wellbeing, seeking help and general mental health should be taught.
attributes.additional_details:
a blog post examing my survey - jessrigg.com 
https://www.bmj.com/content/361/bmj.k2608 
https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/what-we-do/our-work/young-peoples-mental-health

attributes.action: Yemen: Call for ceasefire and support 6-point pledge to end conflict and famine
attributes.background:
With 85k children perished so far and 8m people on verge of starvation, the UK must act to protect the people of Yemen.
The government must call for a ceasefire, the adoption of a new UN Security Council resolution, proper funding of humanitarian relief, and investigation of alleged war crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
The six point pledge was drawn up by NGOs, politicians and members of the UN.

http://blog.handicap-international.org/influenceandethics/2018/11/12/alert-35-organizations-call-for-immediate-cessation-of-hostilities-in-yemen/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/nov/22/famine-yemen-war-crime-civilians-saudi-coalition

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/yemen-war-latest-news-starving-save-the-children-yemeni-famine-a8643906.html

attributes.action: Require schools to buy text books made from recycled materials.
attributes.background: In school, we have been looking at deforestation and the causes and impacts of it. As an individual I have realized that a major issue for deforestation is the need for paper and other school supplies. Instead of cutting down more trees we should use recycled materials to help the environment!
attributes.additional_details: Each year, globally, we are losing 18.7 million acres of forests. Due to this we are left with only 3000 wild tigers across the world. It has been shown that the amazon rain-forest has lost 17% of its trees in the past 50 years, due to forest conversion. In addition, it is shown that trees are our carbon sinks, therefore proving that they inhale the carbon we cant. If they cant inhale this carbon it will be let off into the atmosphere. 15% of all greenhouse gases are due to deforestation.

attributes.action: Make on-line gambling illegal
attributes.background: 24-hour easy access to on-line gambling exacerbates the tragic results of people gambling beyond their means. Ban it completely, by making on-line gambling illegal in the UK
attributes.additional_details: The well-publicised explosion in on-line gambling illustrates how vast fortunes are made by small numbers of owners, at the expense of huge numbers of vulnerable gamblers, including the young and those who can ill afford to spend on gambling. Gambling profits come from one single source: the gamblers' losses. It causes hardship, family rifts, depression and suicides. On-line gambling specifically presents easy opportunities 24/7/365 for people to succumb to temptation to bet beyond their means, without even leaving their homes, and without regard for consequences. There is only one effective solution, which is to ban on-line gambling completely, by making it illegal in the UK

attributes.action: Remove free bus travel from under 16s
attributes.background: Child obesity is big concern in this day & age. By removing free travel, more children would walk to school instead of jumping on bus for just one or two stops!
attributes.additional_details: Removal of children's free travel will not only help obesity, but also cut congestion on buses, where people going to work & the elderly could get a seat

attributes.action: Create provision in law for Overtime Payments & max normal hours to be 40/week!
attributes.background: In current Law there is no provision for maximum working week i.e. what hours an employee must work on normal basis and there is no provision for overtime payments. Working over for free IS EXPLOITATION. and we, the working people who are your employers do deserve payment for worked hours!
attributes.additional_details:
Please set the following in the Employment Law: 
- max contractual normal working hours to be 40 hours per week 
 and anything above and over 40hours/week to be considered overtime 
- make an explicit provision in law that any overtime must be paid for 
 and minimum rates shall be: 
 - 1.33x or above for overtime worked on a normal working day 
 - 1.50x or above for overtime worked on Saturday 
 - 2.00x or above for overtime worked on Sunday or Public/Bank Holiday 
Working for Free is EXPLOITATION

attributes.action: Increase threshold for considering a petition for debate from 100,000 signatures
attributes.background: 100,000 signatures is not a true reflection of the population, and should not be debated in parliament. Present day we have 67 million people in the UK and so 1% of the population would be a more realistic figure. This then can be reviewed every 10 million the population increases.I

attributes.action: Abolish married couple's allowance and marriage allowance
attributes.background: This legislation is outdated and discriminatory. It discriminates against asexuals and aromatics. It is also sexist as for those on married couple's allowance (who married before December 2005), the break is based in the husband's income regardless of who actually earns the most.
attributes.additional_details: I believe this law to be in breach of the Equality Act 2010 as it discriminates on the basis of sexuality and (in the case of the married couple's allowance) gender. I believe this to be archaic and not at all fitting with the present times - married people are not any poorer than cohabiting or single people. So why should they be taxed less? Why do we still have a law that is based on the husband's income? It's 2018 isn't it?

attributes.action: Redirect UK's funds from backup power subsidies to invest in renewable energy.
attributes.background:
ECJ rules UK backup power subsidies are illegal.

These subsidies counterproductively give funds to fossil fuel generators.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.jurist.org/news/2018/11/ecj-rules-uk-backup-power-subsidies-are-illegal/#

http://curia.europa.eu/juris/document/document.jsf?text=&docid=207792&pageIndex=0&doclang=en&mode=req&dir=&occ=first&part=1&cid=1430154

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/nov/15/uk-backup-power-subsidies-illegal-european-court-capacity-market

https://uk.investing.com/news/commodities-news/uk-must-halt-backup-power-scheme-after-eu-court-ruling-1382121

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/jan/30/ban-coal-backup-power-subsidy-scheme-scottishpower

attributes.action: Abolish University Tuition Fees
attributes.background: On average tuition fees cost up to £9,250 a year. People CANT AFFORD this!

attributes.action: Make using someone else’s pictures on dating sites a criminal offence
attributes.background: Using someone else’s photos and private details on social media, dating sites and sex sites should be illegal. It causes distress to the person being impersonated, can be used in a malicious way like I have had done to myself.
attributes.additional_details:
I have had my photo uploaded, nick name only family members know me by, location and made up sexual interests added to sex dating sites claiming I’m unhappily married. By someone I know. 

At the moment there is no law against this but this needs to change as it causes so much hurt and embarrassment, and is a nasty form of bullying. 

People are also lured in by the photo and think they are talking to this person when they actually aren’t which again just causes hurt and embarrassment.

attributes.action: Exempt Start-Up Businesses from the SME R&D Tax Credit Payment PAYE Restriction.
attributes.background: At a time when Britain looks to lead the world in technological innovation, for many start-up businesses, the SME R&D Tax Credit payment provides a vital source of cashflow.  Companies that are carrying out genuine R&D should not be penalised for being unable to afford to hire permanent staff.

attributes.action: Fund a campaign to promote the use of biodegradable hemp packaging
attributes.background: Plastic is fast becoming a problem that humans have caused. Damaging our oceans, infecting sea life and ourselves whilst polluting our planet on a worrying scale. We need to act fast and greatly reduce the amount of plastic being produced. We need to switch to a bio degradable alternative, hemp.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that over 12 tonnes of plastic ends up in our oceans each year. 
The plastic is appearing all over the planet, from beaches here in the U.K. To uninhabited islands in the Pacific. Not only is it choking sealife but it has become part of the food chain eventually ending up on our plate. A biodegradable alternative like Hemp plastic would stop this poison destroying our oceans and our planet.

attributes.action: Ask the government to increase funding for osteoporosis
attributes.background:
The information that is out there is vague nothing definitive also testing not done until too late in most cases 
Like lots of diseases early diagnosis is the way forward

attributes.action: Ban all chewing gum except therapeutic, dental or nicotine chewing gum.
attributes.background: Chewing gum is pointless. Everywhere you look. There are small white blobs on the pavement - in schools, towns, in public transport, under tables and chairs and even in supermarkets making Britian's town's and cities a unsightly place to live.
attributes.additional_details:
The annual clean-up bill on the UK’s streets has been estimated at £150m. Some councils spend £200,000 a year cleaning up gum from pavements with high-powered hoses. Cash-strapped council's could use this money better elsewhere like Housing, transport, education, police funding AND THE NHS.
On average it costs £1.00 for an average pack of chewing gum, but it costs £1.50 to remove a single piece of dropped gum. This is a waste of tax payers money!
It also causes a nuisance in schools.

attributes.action: Include education on domestic abuse to the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I am a survivor of domestic abuse and violence which resulted in me losing my children. I think all children should be educated about domestic abuse so that they can identify it and so that they know it’s not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: My experiences led me to write my experiences down and I’m waiting for a book to emerge be published. I’ve also set up a Facebook page called Parent Alienation Syndrome to help others in my situation.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all adults working with children to be first aid trained.
attributes.background: Not all members of preschool/school staff are first aid trained only a select few. Trained adults can be absent from work or out on a course or a school trip and leave the school without a first aider. This is a particular issue at lunchtimes in school when the adult ratio to children is often low.
attributes.additional_details: Children can have many complex medical needs/ food allergies. As well as everyday trips and bumps in the playground. Unfortunately acciends have been reported in the news and a recent case of a boy choking at lunchtime. All staff should be trained to avoid being left without a first aider for our children when they need one. All adults working with children should know what to do.

attributes.action: Introduce free flu jabs for people using Lithium Carbonate for Bipolar disorder
attributes.background: Lithium Carbonate is considered to be the gold standard for controlling the symptoms of bipolar disorder, however, the symptoms of flu including diarrhoea, vomiting, dehydration and fever are exactly those which can cause Lithium toxicity which can quickly become fatal.
attributes.additional_details: By providing flu vaccinations, the government will be taking a pre-emptive step, reducing the risk of lithium toxicity while, at the same time, reducing the number of hospital beds taken up and allowing treatment of flu victims who require it.

attributes.action: Safeguard School Milk Funding Post-Brexit
attributes.background: With funding for the EU School Milk Scheme under consideration, and the Nursery Milk Scheme being consulted on, millions of children may be at risk of missing out on milk that generations before them received. We're calling on the Government to commit to funding a replacement scheme post-Brexit

attributes.action: Fund a National Holodomor Memorial
attributes.background: The Holodomor was a famine that occurred in the years 1932-33 in what is now Ukraine. It is recognised as genocide or as a criminal act of the Stalinist Regime by 22 countries. While the undersigned support the government's decision not to join these countries, we believe it deserves recognition.
attributes.additional_details: The government has chosen (quite rightly) to construct a memorial to the Holocaust. We believe that the Holodomor was horrific enough to merit this same recognition. A memorial to those who died in the Holodomor (some 7.5 million people, according to some estimates) would serve as a message that the UK truly rejects this kind of evil in whatever form it takes, whether blatant or less conspicuous and whether from the left or the right of the political spectrum.

attributes.action: Ensure school curriculum includes educating students on crime and consequences
attributes.background: Crime at young ages affects everyone in the community. It affects the offender as they should be learning and that is postponed or permanently stopped. It would affect the victim as it would affect any victim mentally. It will also affect the community as a whole, making the area look atrocious.

attributes.action: Make both GCSE English papers optional
attributes.background: I want to the government to remove English from the compulsory or “core” subjects. This is due to the fact that analysis of poems and a 400 year old play will never benefit most people in the working world. In the modern world STEM subjects are much more important and English is irrelevant.

attributes.action: Abandon government plans to include calories on all restaurant menus
attributes.background: The government’s plan to list calories on all restaurant menus not only will remove the joy of eating out at restaurants, but also is a cruel hinderance to those recovering from eating disorders. We need a more nuanced way to define what is “healthy” than obsessively listing and tracking calories.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/09/04/plans-force-restaurants-cafes-takeaways-display-calorie-counts/

attributes.action: all children to attend the school nearest to their home address
attributes.background: Remove parental choice of school - You only have to travel in commuter time in school holidays vs other dates to know how much congestion and pollution,and  along with wasted man hours and traffic collisions are caused by children having to commute to their parents' chosen schools.
attributes.additional_details:
What a waste of time and valuable growing up, as well as the safety risks.

Parents would be better off spending their time energy and money on helping to improve their local school rather than selfishly encouraging their children to attend 'better' ones further away.

attributes.action: Make Senior and 16-25 Railcards follow the same Time & Fare restrictions
attributes.background: The 16-25 Railcard is the same cost and appears to be the same as the Senior Railcard (for over 60's). However, the 16-25 card has a list of restrictions that do not apply to the senior card, including a minimum fare and time restrictions. Why are there not the same allowances?
attributes.additional_details: Apprentices, students & the young in work for the most, have to be up early for Uni/Work etc. and are notoriously hard up, at the start of there careers/working bottom end jobs. However while commuting to work as an apprentice, seeing a senior citizen go from there new range rover to the train, then be receiving a vastly discounted fare for the same journey does not seem fair. There are 2 sides as there are less well off elderly, and youth with money, however why give to one and not the other?

attributes.action: Create a governing body to regulate private landlords to protect tenants
attributes.background: Too many private landlords do not carry out their legal obligations at the detriment of their tenants. A governing body is required to regulate such requirements and support tenants whom need to report such landlords for not meeting safety & obligatory maintenance and to investigate harrassment
attributes.additional_details: If you have been subjected to unsafe living conditions, patronising responses, lack of communication and no action taken on much needed property repairs and/or maintenance, then a regulating body is required to fully investigate in depth. Local authorities currently do not have enough capacity to assist with such needs across the UK.

attributes.action: Require phone providers to stop charging for handsets on expiration of contract
attributes.background: The government should make it law that mobile phone providers should be obliged to make sure that any customers staying in a contract past the end of a fixed deal have their monthly bill reduced to reflect the cost of the handset.
attributes.additional_details:
In October 2017 Citizens Advice found that three of the four largest mobile phone providers – Vodafone, EE and Three – continued to charge customers extra for a handset after it had been paid off as part of their fixed deal.  The majority of people who are caught out by this are the over 65s.

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/about-us/how-citizens-advice-works/media/press-releases/mobile-phone-networks-overcharging-loyal-customers-by-up-to-38-a-month/

attributes.action: Ban night shift working, for the sake of the health of workers
attributes.background: Studies have established that the health of workers in the UK is directly negatively affected by night shift working. I ask Parliament to hold a debate over this practice. Why are hard-working people being made to suffer unnecessarily, and why does the Health and Safety at Work Act not protect them?
attributes.additional_details: Long-term night shift work is associated with an increased risk of certain cancers, as well as metabolic problems, heart disease, ulcers and gastrointestinal problems. People who work night shifts or rotating shifts often don't sleep enough. Long-term sleep deprivation is known to be bad for health. Statistics show that a large amount of UK workers are shift workers and, in particular, night shift workers.

attributes.action: Dual the entire route of the A47
attributes.background: Tens of thousands of vehicles use the A47 every year. It is one of the most important roads in the UK more specifically the East of England. The route is also used by numerous logistics companies. However there are also hundreds of accidents every   causing confusion and delay.

attributes.action: Anti depressants should be free to everyone who suffers depression.
attributes.background: I’m calling for this to be reviewed, contraception is free on the NHS, but a person with a mental disability (depression) is to be charged for having what can’t be prevented. For people who work, prescriptions are chargeable, assuming people can afford it. This is not the case.

attributes.action: Make a mandatory minimum sentence for child sex offenders
attributes.background:
To many sex offenders get let of with community punishment orders ect I think there should be more of a deterrent and a mandatory minimum prison sentence. 
Also the public especially those with children should have acces to view if any registered sex offenders live in the area they reside.

attributes.action: Stop the Lifetime ISA & allow customers to withdraw their money with no penalty
attributes.background: Lifetime Isas allow adults under 40 to save for their first home or pension in one pot with a 25 per cent bonus from the Government. They were revealed in the 2016 budget and launched in April 2017. However, many are being caught out by the strict withdrawal rules.

attributes.action: Require companies to tell applicants the status of their job application.
attributes.background: Applicants should have a right to receive a reply from employers. This petition isn’t to push for critical feedback, but a simple “yes, you have a job” or “no, you haven’t." Failure to reply within a reasonable time-frame should be punished by fines, depending on the company's size.
attributes.additional_details:
A simple reply from an employer can help better a person's options. People seeking work explore and apply for various types of employment, unskilled jobs, career and training programs or apprenticeships; and often, many of these jobs would start around the same time. Some options may be better than others depending on the individual, and a simple reply of “yes”, “no” or “still being reviewed” can improve a person on making a better choice financially or for their lifestyle.

Placing an applicant in a state of suspense and stress, sometimes for months when it comes to programs and apprenticeships is a cruel situation to place anyone in, when a feedback about the application will allow an applicant to move on and accept other options.

attributes.action: Change the level of proof for suicide verdicts to "on balance of probabilities"
attributes.background: Reaching a verdict of suicide demands the case must be made ‘beyond reasonable doubt’, the criminal standard of proof. This skews the figures hiding hundreds more suicides. If the level of proof were changed, there would be greater urgency to fund mental health services for young people.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 there were 6,639 suicides in the UK and Republic of Ireland, but we still believe that there were more that weren't recorded. Half of the people with mental health problems as adults present with symptoms by the age of 14. But only 8% of mental health funding goes to services for children and young people. If these numbers were highlighted we believe that more could be done to alleviate the problems and reduce the risk of someone taking their own life, and not looked upon as a sin.

attributes.action: Registration with the charities commission be mandatory for religious bodies.
attributes.background: We need to ensure all religious organisations collecting money are registered with the charities commission. Therefore they must publish their accounts and be willing to have them independently audited for fraud and questionable use of money.

attributes.action: Government funding for free public transport for stage 4 cancer patients.
attributes.background:
There should be free public transport for people under pension age who have stage 4 cancer, or similarly life-shortening illnesses.
This entitlement will end at pension age to be replaced by the freedom pass.
attributes.additional_details: Those diagnosed with life-shortening illnesses will not have the opportunity to use free public transport for as long as the rest of the public on average.

attributes.action: Make the history of British colonialism part of high school curriculum.
attributes.background: Too many people, especially the new generation do not know anything about the British empire or the colonies which helped make Britain great. Some people are also oblivious to the pain and suffering the Empire caused as well as all the positive impacts it had to less affluent countries.
attributes.additional_details: Britain is a huge multicultural society. Our society, whatever their background need to be taught where they came from and how they got to the positions they are in now. It’s a too wider misconception that there has just been constant mass migrations for no apparent reason. I believe if the history of the British Empire were taught then a lot of what is happening in the present would be sympathised with and more could be done to resolve issues by all ethnicities.

attributes.action: Change law so a caring original owner can reclaim their dog
attributes.background: I was made homeless 4 years ago and was placed in bed and breakfast so I couldn’t take my dog with me. We had him two years from a puppy. So I found a friend who was willing to look after him till I got my home. I was paying for my boys expenses and food only for him to sell him.
attributes.additional_details: The police told me that he was looked after and being fed there’s nothing I could do. Last week I saw a video of my boy at the local kennels immediately made contact. I told them I’m going to do whatever it take to bring him home, They let me go see him. They told me yes he’s my dog he’s in my name still. But he’s been there over 7 days so he’s no longer mine. He’s not allowed home and he’s got a new family. The law should allow people like me to reclaim their pets.

attributes.action: Keep housing numbers under control in already heavily developed areas
attributes.background: This petition calls on the government to re-design the formula (OAN) used to produce housing quotas so that the cumulative impact of previous high levels of housing growth is into account when assessing where new housing should be built to ensure places like Wokingham Borough retain their identity
attributes.additional_details: In Wokingham Borough, we know there is a national shortage of housing, particularly affordable housing, and we are willing to continue to provide new homes locally in the Borough, but a further 20 years of building at the current rate of 660 houses a year is unsustainable and the Borough’s housing quota, known as Objectively Assessed Need, is about to rise, requiring 30% more housing on top of that figure. We are losing green space, have huge traffic issues, and struggle with infrastructure.

attributes.action: Give leave to remain to Commonwealth Citizens and HM Forces service personnel
attributes.background: Give all commonwealth citizens and HM Forces service personnel the indefinite right to live in the UK. We owe an allegiance to the United Kingdom and Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth the Second regardless of our nationality.
attributes.additional_details: Regular or Reserve, Serving or Ex-Service personnel should be protected, especially citizens of the Commonwealth serving in HM Forces. Parliament should pass a law that protect all service members of all branches of the British Forces, regular and reserve. We're not just a number.

attributes.action: Change minimum legal age of marriage in England and Wales to 18
attributes.background:
It's actually so ridiculous that 16 year olds can get married at age 16 with parental permission. 
Just don't think it's right.
attributes.additional_details: What did you do when you were 16 that you regret? Hopefully nothing that legally bound you!

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to have a licence to breed pets
attributes.background: A licence to breed pets will enable Britain to be the real nation of animal lovers it so claims to be! Licensing would show that a person is breeding a pet for the right reasons, not just for money, breeding an animal for good reasons like bringing out the heredity problems in breeds.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017, Battersea dogs home took in 3,373 dogs but only 2,249 rehomed! That leaves over 1,000 dogs without a place to call home. Stop pets being left behind in kennels, catteries and animal shelters. I hope by making people have a licence to breed pets it will reduce the numbers that the animal shelters are crowded by. 
I also hope it will stop animals from being left at the side of the road. 
This in turn will make more people buy a rescue animal instead of a home bread animal.

attributes.action: Reintroduce a reformed national service. (Not just the military)
attributes.background: I feel that service in all areas of the nation will aid not only the country but the people serving it. It will teach life skills and discipline, something that is lacking in today’s society. It will also help to reduce selfishness in future generations.
attributes.additional_details:
2 years in one of the armed forces or emergency services. (This gives time to finish higher education and apprenticeships)
 
For those not eligible to join the services or choosing not to: 2 years as an apprentice tradesman or care worker.
